title: Microsoft Confirms Windows Exploits Bypassing Security Features
description:
Patch Tuesday: Microsoft pushes a massive batch of security-themed updates and calls urgent attention to exploits bypassing security features.

The post Microsoft Confirms Windows Exploits Bypassing Security Features appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Patch Tuesday: Adobe Warns of Critical Flaws in Widely Deployed Software
description:
Adobe ships patches for at least 30 documented security flaws, warning that users are exposed to code execution, security feature bypass and denial-of-service attacks.

The post Patch Tuesday: Adobe Warns of Critical Flaws in Widely Deployed Software appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: French Healthcare Payments Processor Breaches Affect Half of Population
description:
France’s data protection agency CNIL says it is investigating massive data breaches at two companies that manage third-party healthcare payments, warning that more than 33 million people may be affected.

The post French Healthcare Payments Processor Breaches Affect Half of Population appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Willis Lease Finance Corp Discloses Cyberattack
description:
Aircraft parts dealer Willis Lease Finance Corporation (WLFC) notified the SEC that it fell victim to a cyberattack.

The post Willis Lease Finance Corp Discloses Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Bank of America Customer Data Stolen in Data Breach
description:
Bank of America is notifying some customers that their personal information was stolen in a data breach at third-party services provider.

The post Bank of America Customer Data Stolen in Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: JFK Airport Taxi Hackers Sentenced to Prison
description:
Two individuals involved in hacking the taxi dispatch system at JFK airport have been sentenced to prison. 

The post JFK Airport Taxi Hackers Sentenced to Prison appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Ivanti Vulnerability Exploited to Deliver New ‘DSLog’ Backdoor
description:
Backdoor deployed using recent Ivanti VPN vulnerability enables command execution, web request and system log theft.

The post Ivanti Vulnerability Exploited to Deliver New ‘DSLog’ Backdoor appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens Addresses 270 Vulnerabilities
description:
February 2024 ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens and Schneider Electric release a total of 18 new security advisories.

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens Addresses 270 Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Seeing is Believing… and Securing
description:
Because you can’t secure what you can’t see, having real-time asset visibility across the network is vital to maximizing security, minimizing risk, and protecting the enterprise.

The post Seeing is Believing… and Securing appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Ransomware Attack Knocks 100 Romanian Hospitals Offline
description:
Romanian hospitals turn to pen and paper after ransomware attack on centralized healthcare management system.

The post Ransomware Attack Knocks 100 Romanian Hospitals Offline appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: CISA Warns of Roundcube Webmail Vulnerability Exploitation
description:
CISA has added the Roundcube flaw tracked as CVE-2023-43770 to its known exploited vulnerabilities catalog.

The post CISA Warns of Roundcube Webmail Vulnerability Exploitation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Hunter-Killer Malware Tactic Growing: Stealthy, Persistent and Aggressive
description:
A malware tactic dubbed ‘hunter-killer’ is growing, based on an analysis of more than 600,000 malware samples. This may become the standard approach for advanced attacks.

The post Hunter-Killer Malware Tactic Growing: Stealthy, Persistent and Aggressive appeared first on SecurityWeek.
